title: The Last Bite of the Phoenix
premise: When a world-renowned, notoriously cruel food critic drops dead after consuming a perfect 'Phoenix Egg' soufflé—a dish that can only be made by one of three rival chefs he was blackmailing—a disgraced former culinary prodigy turned food truck owner must use her singular palate to taste the truth in the ingredients. Each suspect chef's signature style is a clue, and the key to the murder lies in a subtle, fatal deviation in a recipe known only to the killer.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a former fine-dining star who lost her sense of smell and career in a kitchen fire, but whose 'phantom taste'—an intense mental reconstruction of flavor—is now her greatest weapon.
conflict: Elara must identify the murderer among the culinary elite before the police arrest the wrong chef, all while confronting the industry that discarded her and protecting her own fragile comeback.
setting: Present-day, during the exclusive and cutthroat 'Gastronomic Gala' in a secluded, ultra-modern cliffside resort on the Oregon coast.
tone: Atmospheric and suspenseful, with a rich, sensory focus on food that contrasts with the sharp, bitter rivalries and hidden poison of the professional kitchen world.
